info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 19 at 1:07PM CDT until March 20 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo TX
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening.
* Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham and Deaf Smith.
* 20 Foot Winds...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph.
* Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent.
* Red Flag Threat Index...3 to 5.
* Timing...Until 8 PM Thursday.
info.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
